paper_abstract: A few years ago a nice criterion of Martin-Lof randomness in terms of plain (neither prefix nor monotone) Kolmogorov complexity was found (among many other results, it is published in [5]). In fact Martin-Lof came rather close to the formulation of this criterion around 1970 (see [41 and [7], p. 98); a version of it that involves both plain and prefix complexity(1) was proven by Gacs in 1980 ([2], remark after corollary 5.4 on p. 391). We provide a simple proof of this criterion that uses only elementary arguments very close to the original proof of Levin-Schnorr criterion of randomness (1973) in terms of monotone complexity ([3, 6]).
paper_title: A simple proof of Miller-Yu theorem
